title: Introducing: And The Moon Be Still As Bright
content:
Taking his name from Ray Bradbury’s The Martian Chronicles (I assume), And The Moon Be Still As Bright is seemingly a bizarre act to ‘introduce’ as he already has pretty much an albums worth of material under his belt.

I initially held back on writing about ATMBSAB as I couldn’t find out any information on him whatsoever, but as luck would have it, Sound on the Sound discovered that this project is indeed an offshoot for John Van Deusen of the much hyped group The Lonely Forest.

These debut track from Deusen are slightly rougher round the edges, yet still very worthy of hearing in their own right. There’s the anthemic M83-esque Snow Covered Flowers and the gloriously upbeat Master Works (The Waves), showing the diversity that ATMBSAS possess. Lyrically there’s much to admire as well, take Master Works; ‘I could sit before the sea in write a novel in my head, wouldn’t be nearly as good as all the stories I have read’ which when accompanied by Deusen’s imperfect vocals, conjures up magically imagery. My personal favourites being Mass Effection, an indie-pop gem that any band would be proud of recording and the wonderfully shoegaze inclined Sinking. All in all, there’s much to enjoy about these ten tracks, and they certainly showcase a vast amount of potential; if only they were available to download.
